TL;DR: Live stream Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps in the Concacaf Champions Cup for free on YouTube. Access this free live stream from anywhere in the world with ExpressVPN.

The Concacaf Champions Cup has delivered months of entertainment, but it all comes down to Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps. We're expecting big things from the final matchup of the tournament, as two exciting sides battle it out to get their hands on the trophy. It's going to be electric.

Cruz Azul came through a tough semi final against rivals Tigres, and will host the final by virtue of having a better tournament record than Vancouver Whitecaps. It's going to be tough for the Canadian side in Mexico, but they will be coming into this final with no fear after defeating Inter Miami at the semi-final stage.

If you want to watch Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps in the Concacaf Champions Cup for free from anywhere in the world, we have all the information you need.

When is Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps?

Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps in the Concacaf Champions Cup final kicks off at 9 p.m. ET on June 1. This fixture takes place at the Estadio Olímpico Universitario.

How to watch Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps for free

Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps in the Concacaf Champions Cup final is available to live stream for free on YouTube.

Mashable Top Stories

This free live stream is available in most locations around the world, but not in North or Central America. Fortunately, fans in these excluded territories can still access this free live stream with a VPN. These tools can hide your real IP address (digital location) and connect you to a secure server in the UK (or somewhere else with access), meaning you can unblock free live streams of the Concacaf Champions Cup from anywhere in the world.

Live stream Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps by following these simple steps:

  1. Subscribe to a streaming-friendly VPN (like ExpressVPN)

  2. Download the app to your device of choice (the best VPNs have apps for Windows, Mac, iOS, Android, Linux, and more)

  3. Open up the app and connect to a server in the UK (or somewhere else with access)

  4. Visit YouTube

  5. Live stream Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps for free

The best VPNs for streaming are not free, but most do offer free-trials or money-back guarantees. By leveraging these offers, you can watch Cruz Azul vs. Vancouver Whitecaps in the Concacaf Champions Cup without actually spending anything. This clearly isn't a long-term solution, but it does give you enough time to live stream the Concacaf Champions Cup final before recovering your investment.

If you want to retain permanent access to free streaming services from around the world, you'll need a subscription. Fortunately, the best VPN for streaming live sport is on sale for a limited time.
